intro: Hieracium pallidum subsp. cenomanicum, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to pale green flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a taproot system and produces numerous flowering stems that bear small, inconspicuous flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
